text: Rimrock Jones is a lostThe Library of Congress American Silent Feature Film Survival Catalog: Rimrock Jones 1918 American silent western drama film directed by Donald Crisp and starring Wallace Reid.Progressive Silent Film List: Rimrock Jones at silentera.comThe AFI Catalog of Feature Films: Rimrock Jones ==Cast== *Wallace Reid as Rimrock Jones *Ann Little as Mary Fortune *Charles Stanton Ogle as Hassayamp Hicks *Paul Hurst as Ike Bray *Guy Oliver as Andrew McBain *Fred Huntley as Leon Lockhart *Edna Mae Cooper as Hazel Hardesty *Tote Du Crow as Juan Soto *Gustav von Seyffertitz as Stoddard *Ernest Joy as Jepson *George Kuwa as Woe Chong *Mary Mersch as Mrs. Hardesty ==Reception== Like many American films of the time, Rimrock Jones was subject to cuts by city and state film censorship boards. The Chicago Board of Censors required cuts, in Reel 1, of two scenes of a Mexican and Jones shooting at each other, the flashing of all roulette scenes, and, in Reel 3, two shooting scenes. ==References== ==External links== * * *Surviving lobby posters #one and #two *Lantern slide *Coolidge, Dane (1917), Rimrock Jones, New York: Grosset & Dunlap, on the Internet Archive Category:1918 films Category:American silent feature films Category:American films Category:Films directed by Donald Crisp Category:Lost Western (genre) films Category:Paramount Pictures films Category:1918 Western (genre) films Category:American Western (genre) films Category:American black-and-white films Category:Lost American films Category:1918 lost films
title: Rimrock Jones
